intro: Styphelia depressa, commonly known as the lowland heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and typically grows in acidic, sandy soils. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, and it produces tiny, dark blue berries. Styphelia depressa is often found in open woodlands and pine flatwoods, thriving in moist, well-drained environments. Its low-growing habit and delicate appearance make it a distinctive component of its native habitat.
